meanings.definition: The belief in chance or random events.
meanings.sent1: Many people find comfort in tychisms, accepting that some things happen by chance.
meanings.sent2: Her tychisms led her to believe that everything happens for a reason.
meanings.sent3: The tychisms of the universe make life unpredictable and exciting.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of tychisms, we must learn to embrace uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The concept of tychisms reminds us that not everything is within our control.

meanings.definition: A philosophy that emphasizes the role of randomness in the universe.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lectures on tychisms opened my eyes to the unpredictability of life.
meanings.sent2: Studying tychisms has made me appreciate the beauty of chaos in nature.
meanings.sent3: Some people find solace in the tychisms of existence, finding freedom in randomness.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work was a reflection of the tychisms present in the world around us.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the tychisms of the cosmos can lead to a deeper understanding of our place in the universe.
